Sentencas: In this paper, a series of Sr-Ba-borosilicate glass-ceramics (10-40 mole% B2O3) were prepared to investigate the effect of borate content on the thermal properties as well as volatilization behavior.
Titulo: Tuning the thermal properties of borosilicate glass ceramic seals for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: For crystallized samples with increasing borate contents, the dilatometric softening points decrease, from 702 to 660 degrees C, as do the coefficients of thermal expansion, from 9.5 to 7.5 x 10(-6) K-1.
Titulo: Tuning the thermal properties of borosilicate glass ceramic seals for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In addition, the weight loss from these materials, in wet forming gas at 780 degrees C for 28 days, decreases by a factor of two as the borate content increases from 10 to 40 mole%.
Titulo: Tuning the thermal properties of borosilicate glass ceramic seals for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The borate-containing phase, SrB2O4, forms with increasing borate content.
Titulo: Tuning the thermal properties of borosilicate glass ceramic seals for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The significant improvement in stability against volatility can be attributed to the formation of SrB2O4, which is consistent with the results of thermochemical calculations.
Titulo: Tuning the thermal properties of borosilicate glass ceramic seals for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These results therefore indicate one way to design sealing compositions to use B2O3 to tailor thermal properties without sacrificing thermal stability.
Titulo: Tuning the thermal properties of borosilicate glass ceramic seals for solid oxide fuel cells
